website_summaries.verdict: It's a solid enthusiast "compact" that will please a lot of shooters, but the Nikon Coolpix P7700 doesn't quite deliver at midrange ISO sensitivities and its image-processing overhead might annoy impatient photographers.
pros: A comfortable shooting design and nice photos in bright light number among the strengths of the Nikon Coolpix P7700
cons: The P7700's performance is sluggish, and despite being the largest camera in its class it no longer has an optical viewfinder

website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon Coolpix P7700 has the longest zoom lens of any point-and-shoot camera in its class, but the lens should be stopped down to increase sharpness.
cons: Lens is a tad soft at f/2
No optical viewfinder or EVF option

customer_reviews.title: Still I'm very disappointed with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: After about 1 year owning the camera, with rare use I started having issues with some of the rear buttons, especially the muti-selector dial which would not respond to certain directions. I had to send to repair shop to fix it. Then after another year I started having the issue again, fixing it with another repair. Eventually, after 4 years of light use those buttons are not working permanently and to fix it I would need to change camera main board. Not sure if my particular camera was defective because I haven't seen others reporting the same issues. Still I'm very disappointed with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Serghei

customer_reviews.title: Amazing degree of flexibility in controls from novice to expert!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera 1 week ago and I immediately fell in love with it... it is like a toy for adults allowing you to create fantastic pictures with little effort or with full control of every aspect. I compared it to the G12, G15 and G1x and although many of those cameras offer better lens aperture or sensors none come close to the degree of control it allows to have over the pictures taken. PRO great manual controls, filters, effects, etc very nice pictures with good image quality price is very competitive against G15 and similar prosumer cameras CONTRA full manual needs to be downloaded, box only includes quick start guide sensor could offer slightly better resolution
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: I love the Nikon brand but am going to consider changing ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these, one as a present and one for myself. They both developed the same problem of not being able to detect the SD card when inserted. I have tried different brands and GByte values with no success. Had one repaired and now it is having the same problem! I love the Nikon brand but am going to consider changing to another brand!!! May consider returning both to Amazon for refunds!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Low-light sensitivity needs to be improved, size and weight are good.
customer_reviews.text: Solid camera, sturdy and with excellent megapixels. The problem ultimately, like most cameras, is that low-light sensitivity is kind of poor and the lens is fixed. The camera approaches being too small for my hands and the features are often buried in menus. This makes on-the-go street photography a bit of a challenge. The image quality is perfectly fine. You can also shoot in raw with this camera, which has become increasingly common.
customer_reviews.author: TheHappyGentleman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good compact camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built solid camera, the only thing that may be bothersome is that it does not have an electronic viewfinder(EVF) , so in bight light it may be difficult to see the view screen. The P7800 has the built in EVF but of course is more expensive. It does take very good pictures and is handy in that it can slip into a coat pocket or a small bag. I took it on a trip not long ago and I got some very nice shots with it.
customer_reviews.author: Inthearctic

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect choice for me
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect choice for me. I wanted the flexibility of a higher capability camera. I did NOT want interchangeable lenses however. This camera fills the gap nicely. It provides a nice range of focus from Macro to Telephoto and has a very fast lens for low light photography. I look forward to learning and experiencing all the built in capabilities. The only issue is the User Guide included with the camera. It is mostly a technical description and does not provide any skill building information. For this reason I also purchased a separate P7700 camera specific book by David Busch and recommend that as well.
customer_reviews.author: TBFY2

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm a total newbie when it comes to photography, and I would definitely recommend this as a first camera for amateurs (such as myself). I bought it used for a very low price ($300) but it's a pretty inexpensive camera to begin with, and would've bought it new if buying used wasn't an available option. As soon as I took it out of the box, I noticed the great, sharp picture quality. It's fairly easy to navigate once you've skimmed through the manual. I ultimately chose the COOLPIX P7700 as my starter camera because it has the swiveling, vari-angle screen.
customer_reviews.author: Trista

customer_reviews.title: versitile
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little carry around camera. It has settings for quick point and shooting or you can take full control to get the image effect you want. I was a little surprised by the high quality of the images for the small size sensor. It's nice to be able to shoot video as well, but there is a long time lag before the video recording begins. The stereo sound is pretty good. All around a little heavier and bulkier and than most point-and-shoots but having full control of the settings is worth it. It goes everywhere with me. My SLR's have been staying home since I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful vacation camera - I take it on all my trips!
customer_reviews.text: OMGosh I love this camera. I've been a Canon person for so long, but for my first European trip I went with this Nikon because the bundle price was in my range. This camera has accompany on every overseas trip and most of my domestic travels as well. Great photos, great options I sometimes forget I have, and awesome video. Wonderful vacation camera. The photos were all taken with this camera. I am happy and satisfied with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for enthusiasts who want a compare.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace a Nikon DSLR. I was looking for something small with good image quality. The P7700 has great image quality, and fits my hand really well. I like the available controls, which allows me to use the camera very efficiently. I also think the quality of photos with flash is spectacular. both with the built-in flash, and external speed lights. I recommend this camera for people like me who want good image quality, but don't want to shlep a lot of heavy gear. I find it focuses very well on moving children.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Anybody

customer_reviews.title: cheap buttons fail
customer_reviews.text: disappointed in cheap buttons that fail to operate properly after only a couple of years of little use. Too bad Nikon no longer values it's long-standing reputation for quality. Another one bites the dust.
customer_reviews.author: TomB

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace a Canon that took a fatal fall a few weeks ago. Although I'm really impressed with the camera so far, it isn't 100% point and shoot - at least not for me. I've taken several pictures that have been blurred or otherwise not very good. The Canon was better in this aspect. Guess I need to experiment with the settings to find what works best under certain shooting conditions. The camera is built like a tank and fits perfectly in your hand. It is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: W. Tanksley

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot with nice lens range and aperture
customer_reviews.text: Great point and shoot with nice lens range and aperture, but also the ability to shoot in RAW. My only complaint is the menu button and control is a little wonky in moving across the menus and making a selection. The controls work a little funny in that way ... Not sure if it is just my camera, but sounds like others experience this issue as well.
customer_reviews.author: JB14

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic compact camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera!! I was looking for an affordable small camera with a wide variety of settings. After much searching, this is the camera that I chose. For a small camera, I think it's very adjustable and it works well! The only problem with it is in low-light settings. The ISO isn't very useful, either. But aside from that, this camera is great! It works for me in many different lighting settings.
customer_reviews.author: Mirezz

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about the pictures at all. It's still a bit cumbersome to change settings like aperture, and shutter speed as compared to my Canon EOS D50 DSLR. I needed a camera that isn't a "professional type" camera that I can use at outdoor concerts but could still take pictures almost as good as a DSLR. The only other problem is that it's too easy to accidentally turn the exposure knob on the top by mistake and screw up your photos.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Coolpix P7700
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I use it when I am traveling and when I am on a family outing (when I don’t wish to bring my Large DSLR and lenses) the trade off is no view finder but can put filters and a lens hood on the lens. The controls are outstanding, they spoil me when using my D5000. It is small and travels well.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: It got delivered today and it didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: It got delivered earlier today, I charged the battery and after a couple of hours I insert the battery to the camera press on and it won’t turn on. Also it said it came with a strap, manual and I didn’t receive it. The camera didn’t come to what I believe properly shipped. The package is damaged.
customer_reviews.author: JACKIE

customer_reviews.title: Superb Camera
customer_reviews.text: Superb medium size camera in all respects. I got this as a gift for a camera buff --- I was surprised to see how compact it was for such a quality camera. It easily fits in her purse and is very easy to use and she just loves it. The Nikon takes great pictures and I would consider getting one for myself except it is just a bit large to fit into my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Kimo

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a regular Joe, not a photographer, but this camera rocks! I have had similar camera's made by either Canon or Nikon, this one is perfect for me and my taste. It has macro capabilities which is important for my tasks. Very sturdy, quiet and most of all it looks and feels great. Easy to use controls, takes great videos too.
customer_reviews.author: coffeetogo777

customer_reviews.title: Nikon fan
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this camera for me to take on a pilgrimage to Italy. It's the first fancy camera that I've been able to figure out. I took all of my photos without a flash, some in very low light, and they all turned out so great! I'm excited to keep learning about the features on this camera. It's a great size and has a nice sort of vintage look to it as well.
customer_reviews.author: k.yoshimura

customer_reviews.title: Excellent second camera or first beginner's camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is excellent. I have a Nikon D80 and the P7700 has more options on it, just not an interchangeable lens. However, I picked it for its portability, ease of use, and good quality pictures. We took the camera on an 8-day trip, took both the D80 and P7700 and was glad to have the P7700 when I didn't want to carry the Nikon D80 that is considerably heavier.
customer_reviews.author: MCohen

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera.
customer_reviews.text: It is probably the largest of enthusiasts "compact" cameras, not for jeans pockets, but in a small bag or jacket pocket will go happily. Good image quality, probably a bit soft. The fact that the lens is threaded and takes filters without the need of adapters is an excelent and very rare option in this range. This along with the good, confortable large grip, tilting display and longer zoom made the deal for me and in my opinion makes for a more versatile camera than Canon G15/G16. Very confortable to handle, gives very sure grip. Produces good bokeh effect.
customer_reviews.author: Victor G

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic camera. I also have a dslr, but I don't have any resistance to carrying this coolpix anywhere. it is lightweight, the controls are awesome, my friends and I are crazy about the in camera effects. I absolutely LOVE this camera, and would recommend to anyone looking for a point and shoot with something extra special!
customer_reviews.author: penny lane

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the camera to replace the Nikon Coolpix P7000. This camera is very similar to the P7000, but has an 2.0 Aperture an I believe takes a better picture in low light. It does not have the electronic view finder like the P7000 which I feel is a disadvantage, but overall I am very pleased with this camera..
customer_reviews.author: R D F

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Camera
customer_reviews.text: Boss camera that handles well. Controls are well conceived and thoughtfully laid out. Zooms from (equiv) 28 to 200, has manual, a hot shoe, does RAW. Images have great latitude and rich color with good noise control and characteristically excellent Nikon lens quality. An outstanding camera capable of great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Seadog

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I got this little point and shoot for the zoom and handling of low light. It does both very well. Fantastic video backup as well and nearly all the control of a regular DSLR. If you are looking for something with all the bells and whistles but without wanting to swap lenses, this is your guy.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: P7700 use
customer_reviews.text: Very usable camera, allows you to get totally away from automatic shots. Having to retrain myself a bit and not get lazy, but coming from shooting thousands of shots from my Nikon F2AS, and hundreds with my old Hasselblad F1000, the P7700 will let you use your "eye" again. At times I wish for a viewfinder, and need a few filters for bright light shots, as you cannot see the display well enough to make adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little carry around camera!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this camera. Takes great close up shots. Love the adjustable view finder....I can lean down and take photos from ground level without having to get down there! Very handy for timed shots too.
customer_reviews.author: GroomerLady

customer_reviews.title: Light and flexible
customer_reviews.text: I am able to get as good quality images with this smaller compact Nikon as with my Canon EOS with all its lens and attachments. The Nikon is great for travel and the ability to take stills or movies, both.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Goss

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been pleased with the quality of this little camera, The sensor is a size up from the standard point and shoot digital and allows the opportunity to customize the settings. I was impressed with the video quality also.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Boehlke

customer_reviews.title: Awe-inspiring Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera! Pictures Stills: The stills are awesome the 12 megapixel is a very nice sensor for any condition. I am a consumer, who is learning pro photography. And this camera is perfect for stills! This camera is best for macro. (2cm) Video: The video is nice! 1080p is mind blowing. the only downfall is the AF on video. But the MF is awe-inspiring! Overall: 4.5 stars! (9.5/10)
customer_reviews.author: masroor

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix P7700
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on several cameras before making the purchase, and the Nikon consistently ranked high. After using the Camera several time, I am more than pleased! In fact, many of the pictures that I have taken compare to my DSLR. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: A point an shoot for Photographers: professional and amatuer.
customer_reviews.text: I just love this camera, I take it everywhere along with my D800E. I make good use of it's easily accessible features, and enjoy the fantastic photos it's capable of generating.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera at reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: It does everything we needed to take photos for EBay. We needed the ability to angle the viewing screen. I don't find the newer photo editing software to be as easy as the older version was but I am learning to get the job done, Photo quality is very good. Camera is easy to use. Price thru Amazon was very reasonable and I believe we got a new camera not a refurbished one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: For someone that likes quality photography without the complexity of expensive and heavy SLR cameras, this is a great camera!
customer_reviews.author: Skygod811

customer_reviews.title: Great little camers
customer_reviews.text: Took this little camera with me on a trip to Ireland. I was in the cheap seats at an Elton John concert in Cork and took pictures and video that made me look like I was in row #3! Love It!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Eldredge

customer_reviews.title: fantastic photo quality
customer_reviews.text: this camera is very compact and great for travel, while also offering an enormous array of functions and manual control for a compact digital camera, along with Nikon quality. Has worked very well when I can't bring my larger SLR and full array of equipment along.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another great creation from Nikon
customer_reviews.text: This is another awesome achievement from Nikon. I bought my P7100 two years ago and still serving me good quality pictures and my new P7700 was another great sibling of this hybrid line of camera. Lots of function that I really don't use that much but shoots like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: N-72

customer_reviews.title: excellent travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a d800 and a d300s with several pro lens but never have one of them with me when that special opportunity occurs. I keep the p7700 in my car and have gotten some awesome shots during my work travels. While it is not a professional DSLR, I am reminded of the statement "the best camera is the one you have with you when the opportunity presents".
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Takes great photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my teenage daughter since she began to take interest in serious photography. I am very glad that I picked P7700. It is light, durable, versatile and above all, takes amazingly clear and sharp hi-res photos.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cholvibul

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something simple that would give me great pictures and not spend a ton of money, Got everything I asked for!
customer_reviews.author: Michele E.

customer_reviews.title: Just the right features and size
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera with the convenience of a point and shoot but more features than they usually have. This was a great decision. Picture quality is excellent and it is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great small camera for the serious photographer
customer_reviews.text: the Nikon P7700 is a fantastic upgrade to their past models, I was a p5000 user so this upgrade was welcomed. The low light shooting with this camera us unbelievable, I very seldom use the flash because the 2.0 lens with stabilization works so good in almost all handheld situations were you have any light source. The only downsize is the camera can barely fit inside of a pant pocket and with some pants not at all, so having a belt bag for this camera is a necessity for being out and about.
customer_reviews.author: groovefish

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix P7700
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I use it all the time and it is just the right size. It has everything I need. Nikon's are my cameras.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and confortable camera but zoom and focal distance are pretty poor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: It was my birthday present. This camera takes great pictures and videos. It's fairly easy to use. We love it, comes with usb cord to transfer pictures and videos to computer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect object comparable to the new, all as described. thank you.
customer_reviews.author: emy emi

customer_reviews.title: Great Cammera
customer_reviews.text: I bought it mainly to use it when i wan to travel light and not carry my DSLR but i wanted to keep the same advanced features i have on a DSLR and it works just great! Image quality is beyond of what i expected. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Israel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute for a dslr!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has very complete options & controls, plus additional options to enhance photos. Thought I would miss a viewfinder, but the articulating LCD screen more than makes up for it. Also, the ability to add lenses is great, plus the lens hood I purchased separately does a good job. Not a video shooter, so can't speak to that.
customer_reviews.author: Tacoma girl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Hybrid Camera for a Reduced price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's the perfect mix of DSLR features with the compact size of a point-and-shoot. The price was much lower here, too. I saved over a $150 from other places I looked for the same exact camera. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Shell Sindle

customer_reviews.title: good (home)camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, it's all you need to make somme nice pictures at home or on a vacation when you dont want to bring up your DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Burdujan Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. Very sharp and very easy to use it. I bought this camera to take everywhere with me, and I'm not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Paes Costa

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied If I lost it
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied If I lost it... I would go out and purchase another P7700
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E Blazo

customer_reviews.title: Great 2nd camera to DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Used on vacation. Simple and easy to take around. Love it Quality of pictures is very good. Easy to video
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Mann

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: coming from a D40x . Wanted to have something not as bulky . Impressive picture quality , lots of usefull function in the little package
customer_reviews.author: Hans Mozes

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera.
customer_reviews.text: I like almost everything about this camera, the lent covert is not great. Now I m not a photography wizard and I always used cheap point and shot cameras so the Nikon P7700 feels so much better.
customer_reviews.author: guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Nikon P7700
customer_reviews.text: As always Nikon has come out w/a great camera. I was looking for something to replace my Canon point and shoot and p7700 is now what I carry when I do not want yo carry the bag full of bodies and lenses. Great wide angle very good telephoto for it's size. Close up is unbelievable. If considering this camera, don't wait, far ahead of any small camera made by others (I've tried 3 different makes , NONE compare to this one)
customer_reviews.author: Phil's Coins

customer_reviews.title: Pro camera
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this camera. I had the P7000 when it was new and that some times failed to focus, this has been 100% spot on for over 2000 shots. Pleased I sold my Canon G12 and got this!!
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Great general purpose backup camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens quailty, great feel in hands, an it allows me to leave telephoto lens on my nikon dslr camera.
customer_reviews.author: Elvin D. Spillman

customer_reviews.title: NIKON BABY
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Nikkormat and I still like that camera BUT this one is incredible. I did a bit of research asked some questions and decided that this was the one for me and it is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Lord Rhys

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera to a 10 day trip to Europe. I normally use a Nikon D300 but this compact camera was able to take photos that are equivalent to my D300! It was lightweight and easy to use, even with gloves on. I shot all of the photos in RAW and all of the photos came out very sharp and clear. Great travel camera!
customer_reviews.author: joanne

customer_reviews.title: Versatility In A Small Body
customer_reviews.text: It's a versatile camera in a small package with great image quality. There are a lot to like and only a few not to. Overall great camera at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Span

customer_reviews.title: Very good, easy to complete with a Bluetooth GPS adapter
customer_reviews.text: I bought aand I was impressed by the quality of the images compared to the price of the camera. The only missing feature was the GPS tagging of the pictures, that I solved with a "Aokatec AK-N7700 Bluetooth GPS adapter" and a. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pietro VALOCCHI

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used my DSLR since I got this...
customer_reviews.text: ... for about three months now. There just seems to be a focusing bug that I experience in about 1 out of 10 low light situations. I hope a firmware upgrade solves this soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonmate

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding camera in most ways. I wish the autofocus was a bit faster and the camera a little smaller, but all in all a great value of the money. The ergos are great, the camera fits my hand perfectly. Image quality and the available ways to configure the camera is amazing. The build quality exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: owen f. murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good small camera
customer_reviews.text: This is more than a point and shoot. You can do a lot with it. It takes great pictures !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A. Houck

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Camera??
customer_reviews.text: Great camera..I purchased this whilst travelling on launch date as my camera broke, without testing or reading reviews. I am very happy. This is my take on cameras for travel as well as some shots taken at a recent trip to the Galapagos Islands: [...] [...]
customer_reviews.author: TheNomadWay com

customer_reviews.title: Coolpix P7700
customer_reviews.text: Nikon quality, excellent picture quality, nice size, love the adjustable view screen. More features than I know what to do with. Accepts a third party GEO tagger which adds a nice touch to your photos.
customer_reviews.author: mjd

customer_reviews.title: good for shaky hands
customer_reviews.text: white balance is off. I need to reduce it thru photoshop on every pic. I can't find how to adjust the auto white balance in order to correct this.
customer_reviews.author: kevin lane

customer_reviews.title: Quick good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice pictures, zoom ok, good flash, pictures on back/white great. Handy., many features I have get through. Amazing 60 pics frame option for sports like Diving. Con: slow to turn on. You can miss the right moment. Also on video
customer_reviews.author: camilo ordonez

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this camera for several months now and I must say, this thing has every feature I could ask for. It is certainly made for serious photographers who want maximum control. The smaller sensor does have more noise than say an ASP-C sensor in a Nikon DSLR. But, that's the cost of having a compact unit. It does have some features that even the entry level DSLRs don't have, such as 5 frame bracketing. If you want a smaller camera that you can carry around in your (cargo) pocket and still have the creative freedom that a DSLR offers, I would highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: A great step forward for the P7XXX series BUT....
customer_reviews.text: .....losing the viewfinder was a big mistake, at least for shooters like me. Not only does relying on the LCD become a problem in bright outdoor conditions, but I found more people straining to look at my LCD than watching the actual event at several presentations. Image quality from this camera is a big improvement over the P7000 and P7100, and the dials give you command of nearly everything right on the camera without going into menus. But I just can't get past the loss of that viewfinder for my shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Burkett

customer_reviews.title: GOOD
customer_reviews.text: IT IS A VERY EXCELLENT CAMERA. IT IS LIGHT WITH CLEAR PICTURE. MY HUSBAND AND I LIKE IT VERY MUCH.
customer_reviews.author: taifang Li

customer_reviews.title: More than met my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I Have only used to camera for 25 photos. I love the no shutter lag that I have experienced. I also like the ability to take photos with no flash in a dimly lit room.
customer_reviews.author: All Thumbs

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Like most chinese stuff, lasted less than one year. Purchased it in August and its July and the camera will no longer turn turn on (even after trying 3 different batteries). I've had a Nikon and a Sony do this to me before. Nikon is a Japanese company but this model is made in china (says so on the bottom). $379.00 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: TwoNiner

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately had a mishap and dropped and brought my other camera. My kids birthday party is only a couple weeks away. Love the convenience and pricing to purchase on line. Came very fast. So happy with pictures it takes. Highly recommend for all customers.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great on this camera and I would recommend it to others. The price was very good and competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Hackler

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to carry instead of  SLR when I don't want to carry large camera
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a G12 with a large sensor. The pictures are great, but continued shooting is slow. Close focusing is not very close. I use this when I don't want to carry a large SLR.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Nikon yet!
customer_reviews.text: I recently sold a Nikon full-frame DSLR with a couple of lenses and also a Nikon P7100 and bought this P7700. The P7700 is an excellent camera with outstanding features!
customer_reviews.author: D. Watne

customer_reviews.title: VERY UPSET!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was happy that I got it UNTIL I turned on the camera and it asked me to select a yes or no question once i turned on the camera and I pressed OK and it wouldn't let me select it. Its like it was frozen or something! Why you send a camera that doesn't work that i can't even press the OK or menu button HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I REALLY NEEDED THIS CAMERA THIS WEEKEND.!!! horrible seller.
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Great pics, terrible quality build.
customer_reviews.text: The good: Great photos. Familiar Nikon feel and controls. The bad: It failed on day 9. Powers up but goes full telephoto by itself and no function buttons work. Very polite Technical Assitance but no solution. It's going back. Coincidentally, my Nikon P7000 went back too because the lens cover wouldn't fully open after 1 week. Known problem. Repaired? Nope. Came back from Nikon broken. On a side note, I reviewed the P7000 here and got slammed by users as being critical. Then, the P7100 comes out fixing everything I gave a poor review too. Just say'n.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a compliment to your dSLR, it's not this camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great point and shoot but really nothing more. This camera generates a lot of noise at ISO's above 200, and it is akward to use. This controls on this camera make shooting difficult in A or M modes, and the autofocus is shotty at best. I returned this camera and bought a Fuji x100, best decision I ever made. The Nikon is absolutely not in the same category.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is a good product, but the canon versión is still the best. It has a good size and shape.
customer_reviews.author: YALILE

customer_reviews.title: Lens broke the second day
customer_reviews.text: After many, many hours of research we decided to buy this camera. We wanted a better point and shoot that was still portable. The camera was slow to take pictures and since we have a 1 year old, that lead to many blurry pictures. The second day, the lens got stuck and would not retract. Had to return as defective, but probably would have anyways. Spent the extra money for the Sony RX100 and we are very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica 30

customer_reviews.title: zoom - in and out sounds in video
customer_reviews.text: I have to say the overall quality is very good. But I am still at trial stage to test out this camera. Few questions occurred. 1.Does anyone notice a very clear sound when we zoom-in or out as taking video? is that normal? the sound is so so clear! 2.The zoom in bottom on the camera that I have is not that sensitive, always take like 15 sec to really zoom-in or out, is that also normal? need comments on this!
customer_reviews.author: shopholicjen

customer_reviews.title: nice camera, pathetic lens cap
customer_reviews.text: I have had earlier models of this camera before. The main thing I like about it is the swing out screen. It has a lot of other good features. But this time they have ruined a good camera by giving it a detached lens cap which is not tied to the camera. Every time you go to take a picture you have to fiddle with this little lens cap in your hand. I've nearly lost it several times already.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Bentley

customer_reviews.title: coolpix p7700
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. It's just too bad you can't zoom while in video mode. Image and video quality great. Raw format not recognized by aperture yet. No worries that's why I have my D700.
customer_reviews.author: raincityfotoman

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Sells Gray Market Nikon P7700's
customer_reviews.text: Like some of the previous reviewers have mentioned, I too purchased a P7700 from Amazon and registration with Nikon failed. I am pissed. Paying less than $4 below MSRP and I get a gray market Nikon... WTF? I love Amamzon, but from now on all photography related purchases will be conducted through bhphoto.com (no I don't work there) who clearly labels gray market gear. Ridiculous Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: John Dugan

product_meta.title: Nikon COOLPIX P7700 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 7.1x Optical Zoom NIKKOR ED Glass Lens and 3-inch Vari-Angle LCD (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Meet the COOLPIX P7700, a high-performance compact camera with the power and precision to fuel your creative passions. Its extra-large CMOS image sensor is paired with one of the best NIKKOR lenses we’ve ever put in a COOLPIX camera. Your photos and Full HD (1080p) videos will be second to none. With an Auto Mode you can rely on every time, 19 Scene Modes for getting the most out of every shooting situation, creative in-camera effects, complete PSAM control, RAW shooting and more — the COOLPIX P7700 will go as far as you want to go. For shooters seeking the ultimate compact digital camera performance, the COOLPIX P7700 delivers.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

FROM THE MANUFACTURER

Empower your creative passions with a camera that sacrifices nothing for portability. Create absolutely stunning photos and Full HD (1080p) videos with uncompromising speed. Take complete creative control with PSAM modes, or let one of 19 Scene Modes do the thinking for you. Rethink what's possible with a compact point-and-shoot camera.


IMPRESS WITH EVERY SHOT
ENDLESS CREATIVITY AND SUPERB IMAGE QUALITY
The COOLPIX P7700 satisfies even the most passionate shooters. At its heart is a 1/1.7" 12.2-megapixel CMOS sensor—larger than the sensor in most compact cameras—that delivers exceptional image quality and detail. Use that power to bring every shot to life in vivid clarity. A 7.1x Zoom-NIKKOR glass lens takes you from wide-angle (28mm) to telephoto (200mm) in an instant. Create an expansive landscape one shot, a stunning close-up the next. But as powerful as the COOLPIX P7700 is, you don't need to be a pro to excel with it. Whether you prefer letting Auto Mode do the work for you, using Scene Modes to match your shooting situation or taking complete control of your images with full manual control, you'll be proud of every photo and video you create.

EXCEL IN LOW-LIGHT SITUATIONS
BRIGHT F/2.0 LENS AND HIGHLY SENSITIVE CMOS SENSOR 
Great low-light performance starts with the lens, and the COOLPIX P7700 has one of the best lenses we've ever put in a COOLPIX camera. With a maximum aperture that's wider than most compact cameras (f/2.0), the 7.1x Zoom-NIKKOR glass lens gathers maximum light so you can shoot with faster shutter speeds. Combine that with a highly sensitive CMOS image sensor and Nikon's renowned ISO performance, and you'll capture the shots you've been missing—low-light indoor shots, evening group shots around a fire, nighttime cityscapes, fast-moving subjects and much more.

CREATE WITH REMARKABLE SPEED
FAST OPERATION AND CONTINUOUS SHOOTING
Life moves fast, but the COOLPIX P7700 keeps up. In an instant, it powers up, zooms in, autofocuses and captures stunning shot after shot. Hold down the shutter button and fire a blazing-fast 8 fps (up to 6 shots) for some of the most impressive action-freezing sequences you've ever seen. Plus, every photo and video will be sharp and steady, even if your hands are not—Nikon's VR image stabilization ensures a little camera shake won't ruin the shot.

FIND EXCITING NEW PERSPECTIVES
MOVEABLE 921,000-DOT VARI-ANGLE DISPLAY
When you can swivel your camera's LCD display to just about any position, you're free to explore exciting new perspectives all around you. Hold the COOLPIX P7700 at ground level for a surprising new view of a common scene. In tight, cramped spaces, raise the camera overhead and get the shot or video you need. Every shot you frame, review or share is rendered in 921,000 dots of brilliant detail. When transporting the camera, protect the LCD by flipping it to the closed position.

EXPLORE NEW POSSIBILITIES 
FULL HD (1080P) VIDEO WITH STEREO SOUND
Apply your creativity to videography. With the touch of a button, go from shooting stills to recording Full HD (1080p) videos that can easily be shared on your computer, social networking sites or an HDTV. The COOLPIX P7700 lets you use the optical zoom while recording, so you can frame exactly the shot you want. It also lets you maintain creative control; adjust the aperture and exposure settings, add creative filters, special effects and more. The built-in stereo microphone captures clear, natural audio (it even includes wind noise reduction), but for maximum sound fidelity, add the optional ME-1 stereo microphone.

COMFORTABLE, SMART DESIGN 
The COOLPIX P7700 is designed to be used—as often as possible. Its compact, ergonomic body lets you create comfortably. All the camera's settings are accessible through easy-to-navigate menus, and key features are at your fingertips. You can even program your favorite settings for quick recall.

EXPAND YOUR CAPABILITIES AND CREATIVITY
The COOLPIX P7700 includes a full-size accessory shoe that's compatible with Nikon's most popular D-SLR accessories: Nikon's renowned Speedlights, GP-1 GPS module, ME-1 stereo microphone, and more. Build a creative system around the COOLPIX P7700.



SUPPLIED ACCESSORIES
 * AN-CP22 Strap
 * UC-E17 USB Cable
 * EG-CP16 Audio Video Cable
 * EN-EL14 Rechargeable Li-ion Battery 
 * MH-24 Quick Charger
 * LC-CP26 Lens Cap
 * NikonView NX 2 CD-ROM
feature_bullets: 7.1X optical zoom-NIKKOR ED glass lens with Vibration Reduction
3.0-inch Vari-angle LCD which swivels for easier shots
Full HD (1080p) videos with stereo sound
Fast f/2.0 maximum aperture ideal for brilliant low-light shots

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars172 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
